ygData.subject: RE: Hmm..trying to get back to cleric questions.
ygData.msgSnippet: I have never had to have my SSoL recharged and I have had it for some time. The cleanse effect goes off based upon a check to your dexterity during combat.
ygData.messageBody:
I have never had to have my SSoL "recharged" and I have had it for some
time. The cleanse effect goes off based upon a check to your dexterity
during combat.

Heiser
15th level Dwarven Cleric
Eci

-----Original Message-----
From: Anne Falbo-Ortiz [mailto:topaaz_ladyjay@...]
Sent: Monday, September 13, 1999 9:17 AM
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Hmm..trying to get back to cleric questions.


From: "Anne Falbo-Ortiz" <topaaz_ladyjay@...>

Clerics have a hard time doing the quest? LOL i am a human cleric and had
no troule doing said quest, in fact it was one of the easier ones i have
done. Now for my question, what exactly does clense do? I was under the
impression that it took of negitive effects on the player, tho it always
seems to clense me when i dont need it, and there are only 30 charges on it.

I have no clue how to get it recharged. I am a lvl 24 cleric on Xegony,
and am now using a screaming mace which i perfer, the SSoL was nice, fast,
and consistant in the amount of damg it did, but the effect was wasted on my

toon as i never seem to get many neg effects on me. Suffice it to say I
gave my SSoL to a noobie that was begging, LOL he loved it and i was happy
to help, as far as what it is worth, i have no clue as i would pay nothing
over 20p for it and thats going above the value to me. It's prob worth alot

to ppl who want them badly and less to others that don't. just INHO, stay
safe and have fun


>From: "Deane, Ben" <BDeane@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Hmm..trying to get back to cleric questions.
>Date: Mon, 13 Sep 1999 08:06:18 -0700
>
>From: "Deane, Ben" <BDeane@...>
>
>The SSoL is a funny thing. It is probably worth more than it seems. Similar
>weapons for pure casters (e.g. Water Crystal staff) I've seen selling for
>100pp+. The SSoL is basically a mediocre weapon, but with a pretty useful
>effect. Many clerics cannot do the quest (or don't want to spend time
>building faction). To them, it may be fairly desirable.
>
>I traded my first one to a lvl 30 Teir'dal cleric in return for a pair of
>crested spaulders (AC11, +6sta), and I think I got the better deal. So I
>would say: make your way over to East Commons or Nektulos and you may get a
>good price.
>
>Elbeno
>16 times blessed by Karana
>Bristlebane
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Trizzen Do'Trevan [mailto:trizzen@...]
> > Subject: [EQ-Clerics] Hmm..trying to get back to cleric questions.
> >
> > Second: I know that prices very greatly from server to
> > server, but what
> > sort of price range am I looking at if I want to sell my
> > shinig star of
> > light mace? around 20pp, around 100pp?? I really have no idea, and
> > since I am a broke cleric(is there another kind) I would like to get a
> > proper amount of money for it.
> >
> > All thoughts would be greatly appreciated.
> >
> > Thanks!
> >
> > Eylena
> > Wandering healer of Norrath.
